hanzi-su-wiki:
廃

Значения

Выходить из употребления, устаревать; уничтожать, отменять; прекращать, оставлять, отказываться; прекращать, аннулировать; отставка

Мнемоника

Сокращение. Отставной солдат. Отпущен 發 на покой, под навес 广, т.к. силы уже не те. Приходить в негодность.

Варианты

廢, 废
purpleculture_pinyin:
fèi
Japanese variant of 废
Японский вариант мусора
rtega_mnemonic:
廢廢RS
废废		廃abrogate, terminate, discard, give up
  • place high on the hill 广 where what was shot or started 發/发/発 comes to an end: terminate
heisig_constituent: abolish, cave, dicharge, teepee, wigwam, two, human legs
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: отменить, устаревшие, прекращение, отбрасывая, отказаться от
koohiiStory1: Slaves have been discharged from the caves where they were kept thanks to the abolition of slavery.
koohiiStory2: Guns were abolished, so gun enthusiats left for the hills to discharge their guns in caves.
jp_example_words:
荒廃(こうはい): ruin
廃れる(すたれる): to go out of use, to become obsolete, to die out, to go out of fashion
廃棄(はいき): annullment, disposal, abandon, scrap, discarding, repeal
廃止(はいし): abolition, repeal
jp_readingExamples: 廃る (すた.る), 廃れる (すた.れる)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: This canopy, after your departure, will become obsolete. The canopy was here to protect you and your car, but no one will need it once you're gone.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: During your departure you look back at the obsolete canopy just once. It's standing there, still and alone. It's a really sad sight.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: When something becomes obsolete, you must write a haiku (はい). Honestly, the best haiku are about something ending, so this is perfect.
WaniKani_Reading_Info:
My sweet canopy
I don't need you anymore
You are obsolete
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), 儿 (ножки), 广 (скала с точкой), 癶 (крыша с точками)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the emission (発) under the stony cliff (广) has fallen into disuse

Name meaning

fèi
яп. вм. 废
Radicals: 广, 発  (canopy, departure)
Meaning Mnemonic
This canopy, after your departure, will become obsolete. The canopy was here to protect you and your car, but no one will need it once you're gone.
During your departure you look back at the obsolete canopy just once. It's standing there, still and alone. It's a really sad sight.
Reading Mnemonic
When something becomes obsolete, you must write a haiku (はい). Honestly, the best haiku are about something ending, so this is perfect.
My sweet canopy
I don't need you anymore
You are obsolete
